    Service class that manages User

    • Method Detail

      • insertTest

        public java.util.List<User> insertTest()

      • insertUser

        public User insertUser(User user)
                throws DuplicateDataException
        Inserts a User in database Uses BCrypt to hash password
        Parameters:
        user - the User to insert
        Returns:
        the User just inserted
        Throws:
        DuplicateDataException - if the user already exists in database
        See Also:
        BCrypt

      • updateUser

        public java.lang.String[] updateUser(User user)
                              throws NotFoundException,
                                     UnauthorisedException
        Updates an user. Makes sure that it is not modifying its User.friendList but by removing friends. Also checks if the password has changed, and use BCrypt to hash it.
        Parameters:
        user - the User to update
        Returns:
        an array of String representing the User.pseudo of every friend removed, null if none was removed
        Throws:
        NotFoundException - if the User can't be found in database
        UnauthorisedException - if the User.friendList is not valid
        See Also:
        BCrypt

      • addFriend

        public void addFriend(java.lang.String pseudo1,
                      java.lang.String pseudo2)
               throws NotFoundException
        Adds a friend, which means adding a User with no User.password and no User.friendList in one's User.friendList
        Parameters:
        pseudo1 - one of the User.pseudo
        pseudo2 - the other User.pseudo
        Throws:
        NotFoundException - if one of the User can't be found

      • getUser

        public User getUser(java.lang.String pseudo)
             throws NotFoundException
        Gets a User and updates its User.friendList
        Parameters:
        pseudo - the User.pseudo
        Returns:
        the User
        Throws:
        NotFoundException - if the User can't be found

      • connect

        public boolean connect(java.lang.String pseudo,
                       java.lang.String password)
                throws NotFoundException
        Make sure the credentials given match a User in database
        Parameters:
        pseudo - the User.pseudo
        password - the User.password
        Returns:
        true if parameters match, false otherwise
        Throws:
        NotFoundException - if the user can't be found in database

      • deleteUser

        public void deleteUser(java.lang.String pseudo)
                throws NotFoundException
        Removes a user from database
        Parameters:
        pseudo - the User.pseudo
        Throws:
        NotFoundException - if the user can't be found in database

      • updateCoordinates

        public void updateCoordinates(User user)
                       throws NotFoundException
        Light version of updateUser(User), only updating the User's coordinates
        Parameters:
        user - the User to update
        Throws:
        NotFoundException - if the user can't be found in database
